alert.note: Alert for Hampton, Poquoson; Newport News; Suffolk; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 4:18PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of , the City of Poquoson, the northeastern City of Suffolk, the City of Hampton and the southern City of Newport News through 500 PM EDT... At 418 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Crittenden, or near Churchland, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hampton, Hampton University, Langley AFB, Northampton, Fort Monroe, Buckroe Beach and Grand View around 500 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Hobson, Fox Hill, Phoebus, Langley View, Huntersville, Messick, Hilton Village, Plum Tree Island Refuge and Raleigh Terrace. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Hampton, Poquoson; Newport News; Suffolk; York
